CatDescriptText: Walter Smith, 3531 Milwaukee Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "Personally, I don't think so, because it holds the kids down in their school work and night homework for school. A small job, say for one hour, if all right.  However, a job which takes five or six hours a day, takes too much from the obligations which the kids have in school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Walter Smith wearing dark cap, dark zipper jacket, and corduroy pants, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
